repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
I am looking into cleaning up the spaghetti changes of https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/6073 into proper dedicated PRs.

the API can just create/delete folds but there is no id associated with a fold. As it doesn't add much, feel free to ignore/close/suggest changes to the PR. 

But the effort to make functions "purer" could still be slavaged

comment_data.body:
standard docstring for this is:
```suggestion
/// @param window   Window handle, or 0 for current window
```

this line was confusing until I noticed the function name. This might be clearer:

```suggestion
 * IEMS = "Indent Expr Marker Syntax"
```

Should change the comment to `//` or `///` form also.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1880,6 +1880,7 @@ void foldtext_cleanup(char_u *str)
 /*
  * Update the folding for window "wp", at least from lines "top" to "bot".
  * Return TRUE if any folds did change.
+ * Indent Expr Marker Syntax (IEMS)

comment_data.body: might as well mimic the `nvim_buf_set_lines` docstring for these params.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,6 +19,45 @@
 #include "nvim/window.h"
 #include "nvim/screen.h"
 #include "nvim/move.h"
+#include "nvim/fold.h"
+
+/// Create a fold from line "start" to line "end" (inclusive) in the current
+/// window.
+/// @param window
+/// @param start starting line
+/// @param end starting end

comment_data.body: Does it overwrite a fold set with the same arguments? If so, it should be named `nvim_win_set_fold` rather than "add". Or can there be multiple folds defined on the same range?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,6 +19,45 @@
 #include "nvim/window.h"
 #include "nvim/screen.h"
 #include "nvim/move.h"
+#include "nvim/fold.h"
+
+/// Create a fold from line "start" to line "end" (inclusive) in the current
+/// window.
+/// @param window
+/// @param start starting line
+/// @param end starting end
+/// @param err
+void nvim_win_add_fold(Window window, Integer start, Integer end, Error *err)

comment_data.body: good remark. `zf2j` twice creates 2 identical folds, and they have to be deleted separately so it seems like add_fold is the correct choice. Now I wonder if beiing able to create 2 identical folds makes sense :s
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,6 +19,45 @@
 #include "nvim/window.h"
 #include "nvim/screen.h"
 #include "nvim/move.h"
+#include "nvim/fold.h"
+
+/// Create a fold from line "start" to line "end" (inclusive) in the current
+/// window.
+/// @param window
+/// @param start starting line
+/// @param end starting end
+/// @param err
+void nvim_win_add_fold(Window window, Integer start, Integer end, Error *err)

comment_regular_data.body:
> I am looking into cleaning up the spaghetti changes of #6073 into proper dedicated PRs.

great!
 
> the API can just create/delete folds but there is no id associated with a fold. As it doesn't add much, feel free to ignore/close/suggest changes to the PR.

Is there an id internally? If not, then I'm not sure why that matters (was there previous discussion I'm forgetting?). If there is an id, why not return it from `nvim_win_add_fold`, even if it's useless currently? Because we can't change the API later...

> But the effort to make functions "purer" could still be slavaged

Yes, seems worth doing.

the api feels useless without the ability to get folds. maybe I should add a nvim_(win_)fold_list and return objects like fold_T https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/76d1e9360ae657ae10b3f6d7f99e8c6284d9c5c2/src/nvim/fold.c#L56 .
Maybe the folds will be defined with extmarks ? maybe it's too early to define an api

> maybe I should add a nvim_(win_)fold_list and return objects like fold_T

Yes, sure. It can return the fold_T structures as map/dict. Though the name should be `nvim_win_list_folds`, see `:help dev-api` for naming conventions.

> Maybe the folds will be defined with extmarks ? maybe it's too early to define an api

Even if we add that later, it doesn't affect the signature of `nvim_win_list_folds`, so there is no need to wait.

Would it be possible to add an api func for opening/closing folds? That would be nice for a plugin Iâ€™m working on; would remove the need for using vimscript to open/close folds. Not sure about the details of the functions though.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and agility. Consider helping sustain Neovim development!
repo.name: neovim

title: folds: introduce some api
